intro: Senecio lapathifolius, commonly known as the woolly blueweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
